item.title: U.S. and Israel Launch Strikes on Iranian Nuclear Sites
item.description: The U.S. and Israel have conducted coordinated airstrikes on Iran’s Fordow nuclear facility and other military targets, escalating tensions in the Middle East. The UN warns of a “spiral of chaos” as Iran vows retaliation.

item.title: Global Markets Show Resilience Amid Middle East Crisis
item.description: Despite the geopolitical shock, global markets remained stable, with oil prices briefly spiking before settling. Analysts attribute the calm to OPEC+ spare capacity and investor confidence in containment.

item.title: South Korea Declares Emergency Over Middle East Tensions
item.description: President Lee Jae-myung activated emergency measures to protect South Korea’s economy, heavily reliant on Middle Eastern oil. The government is preparing supplemental budgets and fuel reserves.

item.title: Russian Airstrikes Kill 10 in Kyiv
item.description: A major Russian drone and missile attack on Kyiv has killed at least 10 people, striking residential areas and a hospital. This marks the second such attack in a week.

item.title: Zelenskiy Visits UK to Request More Defense Aid
item.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy is in the UK seeking additional military support. NATO is expected to raise defense spending targets at its upcoming summit.

item.title: Thailand Reshuffles Cabinet Amid Political Tensions
item.description: Thailand’s government announced a Cabinet reshuffle to stabilize its coalition after the Bhumjaithai party’s exit. The move aims to restore confidence and legislative momentum.

item.title: UN Chief Condemns Escalation in Middle East
item.description: UN Secretary-General António Guterres expressed grave concern over the U.S. and Israeli strikes, calling for immediate de-escalation. He warned the region cannot endure another cycle of destruction.

item.title: Iran Threatens to Close Strait of Hormuz
item.description: In response to the attacks, Iran has hinted at closing the Strait of Hormuz, a critical global oil shipping route. Such a move could have major implications for global energy markets.

item.title: U.S. Political Divide Over Iran Strikes
item.description: President Trump ordered the strikes without congressional approval, briefing only select Republican lawmakers. Democrats and international observers have criticized the move as reckless.

item.title: Global Diplomatic Push to Prevent Wider War
item.description: World leaders, including Russia’s Putin and EU officials, are urging restraint and renewed diplomacy. Emergency UN Security Council meetings are underway.

item.title: UK Cuts Green Levies to Support Industry
item.description: The UK government announced it will remove green levies from energy bills for key industries like automotive and aerospace. The move aims to boost competitiveness amid high energy costs.

item.title: Bride Killed in Wedding Party Shooting in France
item.description: A bride was fatally shot during an attack on a wedding party near Avignon, France. The suspected attacker was also killed in what appears to be a targeted incident.

item.title: EU Council Debates Mental Health Protections for Youth
item.description: European ministers are calling for stronger protections for children and teens from digital-era mental health risks. Proposals include tighter regulation of e-cigarettes and online content.

item.title: EU Approves €202 Million in Aid for Palestinian Services
item.description: The EU has pledged over €200 million to support essential services in Palestinian territories via UNRWA and the Palestinian Authority. The funding aims to stabilize humanitarian conditions.

item.title: Commission Reviews Safety of Menstrual Products
item.description: The European Commission is reviewing transparency and safety standards for menstrual products. This follows concerns about chemical composition and consumer health.
